title: Characterizing narrative time in books through fluctuations in power and danger arcs. (arXiv:2208.09496v3 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: While quantitative methods have been used to examine changes in word usage in books, studies have focused on overall trends, such as the shapes of narratives, which are independent of book length. We instead look at how words change over the course of a book as a function of the number of words, rather than the fraction of the book, completed at any given point; we define this measure as "cumulative word-time". Using ousiometrics, a reinterpretation of the valence-arousal-dominance framework of meaning obtained from semantic differentials, we convert text into time series of power and danger scores in cumulative word-time. Each time series is then decomposed using empirical mode decomposition into a sum of constituent oscillatory modes and a non-oscillatory trend. translated_abstract: 尽管运用定量方法来研究书籍中词语使用的变化，但目前的研究都集中在总体趋势上，比如说独立于书籍长度的叙述形式。本篇论文转而研究书籍中的词语如何随着阅读量而变化，而非在书籍中占有的比例，我们定义这个度量为“累积词语时间”。我们使用ousiometrics技术，这是一种从语义不同中获得的情感体系框架重解释，将文本转化为功率和危险分数随累积词语时间的时间序列。随后，使用经验模态分解将每个时间序列分解成一系列成分振荡模式和一条非振荡趋势。通过对比原始功率和危险时间序列与洗牌文本派生的分解结果，我们发现短篇书籍只有一般性的趋势，而长篇书籍除了趋势之外还有波动。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新的方法，通过累积词语时间来研究书籍中的叙述时间，通过功率和危险曲线的分析，可以发现长篇书籍除了总体趋势外还有波动。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new method for studying narrative time in books by examining changes in words over cumulative word-time. The analysis of power and danger curves reveals fluctuations in longer books in addition to overall trends.
